title: Refraction - TIR for laser in a fluid in a tank

content.description: A laser is submerged in the middle of a tank of fluid, as shown in the figure. The fluid has an index of refraction such that total internal reflection occurs whenever the angle of incidence in the fluid is greater than <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> at the surface between the fluid and air. Assume that the surface of the fluid is perfectly smooth and horizontal.
content.question: The laser is initially directed vertically upward. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the laser starts rotating clockwise so that the beam is directed at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> from the vertical, where <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> increases with time. <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> at time <math alttext="t equals t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>, and continues increasing thereafter. The laser beam makes a visible spot wherever it hits the right-hand wall above the fluid surface. Which of the following correctly describes the time and location at which the spot from the laser beam disappears?

choices.label: The spot disappears when it reaches Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math> at <math alttext="t equals t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>.

The spot disappears when it reaches Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> at some time <math alttext="t is greater than t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>.

The spot disappears when it reaches Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> at <math alttext="t equals t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>.

The spot disappears when it reaches Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> at some time <math alttext="t is greater than t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: The spot disappears when it reaches Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> at <math alttext="t equals t sub 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>45</mn></msub></math>.
